Package me.dessie.dessielib.core.events.slot

Class SlotEventHelper

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.core.events.slot.SlotEventHelper
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.event.Listener
public class SlotEventHelper extends Object implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
Called when an Inventory slot is changed, can be a non-player Inventory. Note: Before this event will fire, you must register it by calling register(JavaPlugin) This event should handle: 1. A Player equipping armor 2. Armor being dispensed onto a Player 3. A Player's item breaks (and therefore no longer exists) 4. Player dropping/picking up items 5. Swapping items with main/offhands. 6. Player interacting with their inventory (This is not cancellable) 7. Crafting result generated

    • getSlotFromArmorPiece

      public static int getSlotFromArmorPiece(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Attempts to find an armor slot index for the provided ItemStack. If the item can be placed in that armor slot, then the slot number is returned. If the ItemStack does not fit into any slot, -1 is returned. Helmets, Pumpkins, Skulls return 39 Chesplates and Elytra return 38 Leggings return 37 Boots return 36
      Parameters:
      item - The item to find the appropriate armor slot for
      Returns:
      The slot that the item fits in, or -1 if no slot fits.

    • getSlotFromArmorPiece

      public static int getSlotFromArmorPiece(org.bukkit.Material material)
      Attempts to find an armor slot index for the provided Material. If the material can be placed in that armor slot, then the slot number is returned. If the Material does not fit into any slot, -1 is returned. Helmets, Pumpkins, Skulls return 39 Chesplates and Elytra return 38 Leggings return 37 Boots return 36
      Parameters:
      material - The item to find the appropriate armor slot for
      Returns:
      The slot that the material fits in, or -1 if no slot fits.

    • isInteractable

      public static boolean isInteractable(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      Parameters:
      player - The player who clicked
      block - The clicked block
      Returns:
      if a block allows armor to be equipped when right-clicking it

    • isNullOrAir

      public static boolean isNullOrAir(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Returns if a provided ItemStack is null or has a Material of Material.AIR. Spigot is sometimes inconsistent when it returns an empty ItemStack or a null one, so this method should easily cover either case, whichever happens to occur.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemStack to check.
      Returns:
      If the ItemStack is null or has a Material of AIR.
